-1.title: Twice as Nice Rice
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: In for an Indian
1.plot: One of the kids asks Annabel to help introduce her friend to Indian food.

2.title: Bobo the Penguin
2.plot: Annabel is planning a birthday party with some amazing animal-themed food that is healthy too.

3.title: Pearl's PC Problem
3.plot: Pearl's computer isn't working and she can't order any ingredients.

4.title: Home to Roost
4.plot: Jimmy sneaks a chicken into the kitchen so he can take care of her for a friend.

5.title: Take It Away
5.plot: One of the children won't eat anything except takeaways. So Annabel shows how to cook Chinese food that is tasty as well as healthy and nutritious.

6.title: Cousin Nigel
6.plot: Jimmy's cousin Nigel comes to stay and he hates fish. But using a clever recipe, Annabel and the children convert him to enjoying eating tasty salmon skewers.

7.title: Polar Bear's Picnic
7.plot: Jimmy is pining over the loss of his favourite polar bear called Mike. So Annabel shows the kids how to cook and decorate scrumptious bear-themed food.

8.title: Marathon Penguin
8.plot: Jimmy is in training to run in a penguin marathon! Annabel agrees to be his nutritionist and teaches him about high energy foods, with some delicious examples.

9.title: Leftover Lunch
9.plot: Jimmy has made a slight miscalculation when catering for some famous musicians. So Annabel shows the children how to make a complete delicious meal using leftovers.

10.title: Kitchen Strikes Back
10.plot: The kitchen equipment is playing up, so Annabel cheers the kids up by showing them how to make delightful animals out of fruit and vegetables.

11.title: Easter Penguin
11.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

12.title: Cupcakes and Brownies
12.plot: Some Girl Guide Brownies have failed to sell any of their charity cupcakes. Annabel shows them how to cook and decorate them. Jimmy gives a master class in selling but ends up eating the cakes himself because the kids do such a good job.

13.title: If I Were a Sculptor
13.plot: Jimmy attempts to make his friend an ice sculpture for his birthday, but it keeps melting and won't fit in his fridge.

14.title: Prize Potato
14.plot: Pearl is entering a sculpture competition but her flippers are all confused. Jimmy has ordered too many potatoes so Annabel suggests she make a potato sculpture. Pearl's sculpture wins the prize but someone gets hungry and it disappears.

15.title: Midnight Feast
15.plot: The kids are coming over to Annabel's for a sleepover. She shows them how to prepare a banquet of finger foods - and Jimmy terrifies himself with a ghost story.

19.title: On the Ball
19.plot:

imdb.plot outline: Annabel and her team are here to take you and your children on a culinary journey of exploration and come up with winning solutions in a humorous and light-hearted way, proving that cooking really can be child's play. Annabel is joined in her stylish loft apartment by Jimmy, her often unpredictable intern from the South Pole, a calamity - prone, fish-mad penguin who's made his home in her fridge and Pearl, Annabel's right hand penguin who organises the website and deals with ordering ingredients and finding the perfect perfect recipe to suit every occasion. Watching over everything and providing a singing commentary on kitchen activities,are Candice, Dionne and Lola - three of the most pampered, vain and ditsy princess cupcakes in the land. Finally, there are Jimmy's marvellous mechanical aids that he's made for Annabel. There's every cooks dream, the Fruit 'n' Vegetabilizer, which slices, dices, chops or squeezes any fruit or vegetable into whatever shape you'd like. The Cookatron is a cunning oven where food is cooked to perfection in seconds. And finally, the ultimate food critic, the Yummy Scrummy-o-meter, which sniffs food for deliciousness. Each week, the children come and hang out with Annabel in her loft apartment and Annabel, Jimmy, Pearl and a host of hilarious guest characters help the children overcome a different food related problem in an entertaining way. The kids watch and learn as Annabel does what she loves best- inspiring children to make their favourite meals and try something new.
imdb.title: Annabel's Kitchen
plot: Annabel and her team are here to take you and your children on a culinary journey of exploration and come up with winning solutions in a humorous and light-hearted way, proving that cooking really can be child's play. Annabel is joined in her stylish loft apartment by Jimmy, her often unpredictable intern from the South Pole, a calamity - prone, fish-mad penguin who's made his home in her fridge and Pearl, Annabel's right hand penguin who organises the website and deals with ordering ingredients and finding the perfect perfect recipe to suit every occasion. Watching over everything and providing a singing commentary on kitchen activities,are Candice, Dionne and Lola - three of the most pampered, vain and ditsy princess cupcakes in the land. Finally, there are Jimmy's marvellous mechanical aids that he's made for Annabel. There's every cooks dream, the Fruit 'n' Vegetabilizer, which slices, dices, chops or squeezes any fruit or vegetable into whatever shape you'd like. The Cookatron is a cunning oven where food is cooked to perfection in seconds. And finally, the ultimate food critic, the Yummy Scrummy-o-meter, which sniffs food for deliciousness. Each week, the children come and hang out with Annabel in her loft apartment and Annabel, Jimmy, Pearl and a host of hilarious guest characters help the children overcome a different food related problem in an entertaining way. The kids watch and learn as Annabel does what she loves best- inspiring children to make their favourite meals and try something new.::Nick Karmel
